author: ethdreamer
content: Looks like zkSync has a withdrawal queue that you can enter with a transaction on L1. If your tx is not processed within a week by the operator, the contract changes state and lets everyone withdraw with a single L1 transaction

author: davy7913
content: Hey. Iâ€™m a STEM teacher who has a love for Ethereum. I would love to help any way I can with the education side of things.  Are there any problems (education) that need to be solved?

author: sky.cactus
content: So many.

author: sky.cactus
content:
* Teaching people how to appropriately secure their assets.
* Teaching people how gas works (though probably best to wait until EIP-1559 launches).
* Teaching people how to secure recovery words.

author: sky.cactus
content: * Teaching people what it means to be ones own bank.

author: davy7913
content: Writing guides / videos? Or more hands on aka workshops?

author: sky.cactus
content: Guides/videos I think are valuable.  There is a ton of stuff already out there, but it is difficult to find *quality* content in my experience.

author: davy7913
content: Agreed. Most of it is written for the wrong audience

author: sky.cactus
content: I would like to see more stuff targeting total newbies.

author: sky.cactus
content: That helps them get a grasp on the basics like what it means to "be your own bank" and when it is appropriate/reasonable to choose that over a custodial solution.

author: sky.cactus
content: Not everyone *should* be their own bank, but also not everyone should use a custodial solution.

author: davy7913
content: Now that is something I could work with. Teaching Elementary kid students how to use Python is my speciality. ðŸ™‚ if I can get kids to understand something I can try helping adults ðŸ˜›

author: sky.cactus
content: In my experience, children are *far* easier to teach than adults.  ðŸ˜›

author: sky.cactus
content: Though, maybe we should just teach the kids, and then the kids will teach the adults.  ðŸ˜„

author: sky.cactus
content: Perhaps some online educational content targeting 4-10 year olds on monetary policy?  ðŸ˜¬

author: davy7913

author: sky.cactus
content: Yeah, testnet content could work.  Or private network.

author: davy7913

author: davy7913

author: davy7913

author: sky.cactus
content: If you want to teach people to code (not just use Ethereum) then there is a lot of opportunity similar to CryptoZombies I think.

author: davy7913
content: But something where people with no coding knowledge can also participate. Artist can design the website. Etc

author: sky.cactus
content: I have had a number of people express interest to me in learning to write dapps, but they aren't starting with a programming background and they get a bit stuck on CryptoZombies.

author: davy7913
content: Exactly!

author: protolambda
content: Originally this whole discord server was focused on Eth2. The education channel just stuck in place. We could either move it to another category, or create an additional eth1 education channel. What do you think is better?

author: sky.cactus
content: I would prefer a general education channel I think.  Based on history of this channel, I don't think we need to worry about too much content to overwhelm a single shared channel.  ðŸ™‚
